lines.content: an interactive chatbot application designed to manage tasks efficiently. This project supports various task-related commands, including adding, marking, deleting, and finding tasks. Below are instructions and details of the implementation.
Task Management: Add, delete, and modify tasks in real-time.
File Storage: Save and load tasks from a file on disk.
Command Recognition: Recognizes multiple task types (e.g., todo, deadline, event).
Open the terminal and run the project:
2. todo, deadline, event: Add different types of tasks.
4. mark, unmark: mark or unmark the task as done.
6. stats: see the stats of tasks done and not done.
Include Unit Tests and System Tests for error handling.
Note: The project currently supports simple text-based task commands. Future enhancements may include GUI integration and additional features.
Feel free to explore the code, submit PRs, and contribute to the project! üòä

+ "2. deadline + [task name] + /by + [dd/MM/yyyy] to add a deadline // e.g., deadline homework /by 2/12/2019\n"
+ "3. event + [task name] + /from [dd/MM/yyyy] /to [dd/MM/yyyy] to add an event // e.g. event lunch /from 2/12/2019 /to 2/12/2019\n"
+ "4. list to show the tasks added\n"
+ "5. mark + [task index] to mark a task as done\n"
+ "6. unmark + [task index] to unmark a task as not done\n"
+ "7. stats to show the statistics of the tasks\n"
+ "8. delete + [task index] to delete a task\n"

assertEquals(0, taskList.getSize(), "Initial size of list should be 0");
assertEquals(test, taskList.getTask(0), "Test insert todo into list");
assertEquals(0, taskList.getSize(), "Size of list after deletion should be 0");
assertEquals(2, taskList.getSize(), "Initial size of list with provided values should be 2");
assertEquals(3, taskList.getSize(), "Size of list after addition should be 3");
assertEquals(todo, taskList.getTask(0), "Test get todo from list");
assertEquals(deadline, taskList.getTask(1), "Test get deadline from list");
assertEquals(event, taskList.getTask(2), "Test get event from list");
assertEquals(2, taskList.getSize(), "Size of list after deletion should be 2");
assertEquals(deadline, taskList.getTask(0), "Test get deadline from list");
assertEquals(event, taskList.getTask(1), "Test get event from list");
assertEquals("[D][ ] ddl (by: Jan 01 2025)", test.toString(), "toString() method works");
assertEquals("[D][x] ddl (by: Jan 01 2025)", test.toString(), "markTask() method works");
assertEquals("[E][ ] event (from: Jan 12 2025 to: Jan 12 2025)", test.toString(), "toString() method works");
assertEquals("[E][x] event (from: Jan 12 2025 to: Jan 12 2025)", test.toString(), "markTask() method works");
